Dow Jones giants Apple (AAPL) and Goldman Sachs (GS) reportedly are teaming up to issue a credit card.The card will have Apple Pay branding and could launch early next year, sources told the Wall Street Journal it will carry. It's another way for the iPhone giant to extract cash from customers and boost its Apple Pay profile. For Goldman Sachs, which is moving into retail banking, this would be the first time that it's issues a credit card.Apple and Goldman are working out the terms and benefits of the planned card. In addition, the partnership will see Goldman offer in-Apple Store loans to customers buying iPhones and other products.An Apple-Goldman card would push aside Barclays (BCS) as Apple's rewards-card partner. Apple and U.K.-based Barclays currently offer a credit card with interest-free financing on Apple devices and points toward Apple Store and iTunes gift cards.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseApple rose 1.4% to 190.04 on the stock market today, hitting a new all-time high and rising for a ninth straight session. The stock is just extended from a 179.04 buy point in a double-bottom base, MarketSmith analysis shows. Goldman rose 0.7%, but hit resistance at its 200-day line. Barclays inched up 0.7%.Apple is trying to ramp up services revenue as iPhone sales growth slows down. The Apple Pay platform generates revenue on each transaction, however adoption has been slower than executives hoped. Improving use is a key part of its strategy.Goldman is seeking to move into consumer banking to offset a slump in its core securities-trading business. Revenue has fallen by more than 60% since the financial crisis, though its once-quiet bond and stock trading desks roared back to life in the first quarter.Back in 2016 it launched retail banking business Marcus for online savings accounts and personal loans. Last month the company said it had bought the personal finance app Clarity Money, which will strengthen its Marcus online lending service. Management is also looking into adding credit cards and wealth-management tools."This move clearly shows that Goldman Sachs sees big opportunity in credit cards," said Matt Schulz, CreditCards.com's senior industry analyst. "Despite worries in the industry about the rising cost of rewards and the uptick in delinquencies, banks still make a ton of profit off of credit cards and Goldman Sachs wants to get its share."Schulz added: "This isn't just about short-term profits for Goldman Sachs. It's also about branding. It's about tying their brand with Apple's hugely powerful brand and potentially establishing long-term relationships with Apple's highly desirable customer base, who tend to be younger than your typical Goldman client, more affluent than the average American and famously loyal to Apple."Amazon (AMZN) reportedly has talked with JPMorgan Chase (JPM) and Capital One Financial (COF) to create a checking-account-like product intended to attract teenagers that don't have credit or debit cards.Amazon's business-lending service also has reportedly partnered with Bank of America (BAC) to offer small-business loans.An account for cardless teenagers would allow Amazon to draw in that population early. It would also give the online sales gaint, already armed with reams of customer data, a greater sense of their purchasing habits.YOU MAY ALSO BE INTERESTED IN:Amazon, JPMorgan Chase, Capital One Mull Accounts For Generation Z Victoria's Secret Parent L Brands Stock Dives On Profit Warning, Flat Comparable Sales Stock Market Bears Still Hibernate As This Asset Outperforms Equities Dow Jones Industrial Average And Dow Stocks: News And Analysis How To Make Money In Stocks Using The CAN SLIM Investing System

Electronic Arts (EA) shares surged Wednesday after the company's reported strength in several of its video game franchises helped it to better-than-expected results for the fiscal fourth quarter.EA shares jumped 5.8% to close at 131.01 on the stock market today, touching a buy zone but finishing just below. EA stock has formed a flat base with a buy point of 131.23 over the past eight weeks.Late Tuesday, the Redwood City, Calif.-based company posted adjusted earnings per share of $1.27 on adjusted sales of $1.26 billion for the quarter that ended March 31. Analysts expected earnings of $1.16 a share on sales of $1.23 billion.EA executives credited the strength of its gaming franchises, including "FIFA," "Battlefield" and "The Sims," for its outperformance during the quarter.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseElectronic Arts stock received six price-target increases from Wall Street analysts following the earnings report. All six rate the stock as buy.The most bullish of the group was Wedbush Securities analyst Michael Pachter. He reiterated his outperform rating on EA and upped his price target to 158 from 138."We expect significant growth for the foreseeable future driven by cost discipline, digital sales growth, and several key evergreen franchises," Pachter said in a note to clients.Management's guidance for the year-ahead is conservative, he said. Its outlook is "close enough" to expectations to not be alarming, Pachter said.EA guided to adjusted earnings per share of $4.85 on revenue of $5.55 billion for fiscal 2019. Analysts expected $5 and $5.61 billion.Key games launching this year include a new title in the "Battlefield" franchise and a new game property called "Anthem."RELATED:Video Game Stocks Rise, Shake Off 'Fortnite' Threat

Top stocks may outperform in a market correction, but most will still struggle. So while investors should be looking for pockets of strength, holding or buying them is a dicey proposition. Nike (NKE), Diamondback Energy (FANG), Continental Resources (CLR), Floor & Decor (FND),  Five Below (FIVE) and Lockheed Martin (LMT) were all good examples in Monday's stock market trading.The world's largest supplier of athletic shoes and apparel has been consolidating since the end of February. Nike's relative strength line until recently was trading at consolidation highs, according to MarketSmith analysis. That rising RS line reflected the stock's outperformance vs. the S&P 500 index. Several other apparel makers and retailers have been top stocks in recent weeks.Nike also recently reported better-than-expected earnings and predicted a North America sales revival. That prompted Jefferies retail analyst Randal Konik to say Nike  is "back in business."But on Monday, shares tumbled 3.5% to 64.12, losing sight of its 50-day line.The gas and oil exploration and production firm is focused on the hot Permian Basin. Diamondback Energy cleared a cup-with-handle buy point of 131.68 on March 23 with the RS line hitting new highs. Several other shale-related plays were at or near buys. But Diamondback quickly fell back below the entry as crude prices began to waver.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseBut on Monday, Diamondback Energy fell 3.4% to 122.26, invalidating that buy point and sending the stock tumbling through its 50-day line. Along with the general stock market sell-off, crude futures fell 3%.Diamondback is a good example of why it's risky to buy or hold seemingly top stocks in a weak market. Sometimes they'll hold up reasonably well for a time, then suddenly break support.The U.S. shale operator flirted with a 58.99 buy point several times in late March. Shares fell 2.1% to 57.70 on Monday. The buy point is still valid and the stock is well above the 50-day moving average. The RS line is acting well, but relative strength is small comfort when investors face absolute losses.IBD 50 member Floor & Decor has seen its value soar since going public in April last year. Floor & Decor is actually extended from a 48.77 cup-with-handle base, hitting a record 53.77 early Monday. But the stock reversed to trade down 1% to 51.59.The RS line hit all-time highs Monday. But the flooring retailer faces the risk of a stock ceiling vs. a stock floor.The teen-oriented discounter saw shares slide 1.5% to 72.27 on Monday. Its breakout from a cup-with-handle base from a 71.69 entry now looks under threat.The defense contractor saw its stock price descend 1.5% to 333 Monday. It has been building a flat base for the past five weeks and is aiming for a correct entry point of 363. The stock is falling further below its 50-day line. Its RS line is still near highs.Lockheed was among the top Pentagon contractors to benefit from a huge bump in military spending under the $1.3 trillion fiscal 2018 budget that President Trump signed late last month.Lawmakers earmarked $654.6 billion for the Pentagon, an increase of $61.1 billion from the 2017 budget, as global tensions increase in North Korea, Russia, China and the Middle East.YOU MAY ALSO BE INTERESTED IN:Retail Stocks Dominate New High List Amid Weakness In Broad MarketDoing This Could Protect Your Portfolio During 'Nasty Equity Events'Consider These Defense Contractors For Your Stock ArsenalWhy The Stock Market Sold Off, And What You Should Do Now

In every issue of IBD Weekly, mini weekly charts for each stock of the IBD 50 stocks offer a concise snippet of guidance. The goal: answer many key questions.Is the stock in buy range? Or too far extended? Should you snatch some gains now? Or is the stock selling off so badly that a full exit is the right move?Is there another place to get even more detailed commentary and insight on what the top leaders are doing right now? Yes. Leaderboard, which launched a brand-new interface and new features on Thursday, can help.IBD's market writers create annotations on daily and weekly charts of the top 10 stocks ranked within the IBD 50. When one of these stocks hits an ideal time to buy, a blue annotation gets added. For sell signals, watch for annotations in red.These features arm both the beginning investor and the seasoned veteran with even more expertise on market timing. These annotations are placed in real time and are based on the rules IBD has developed through decades of research on what actually works in the stock market.Leaderboard users see regular updates on current action and a "Leaderboard analysis" for these top 10 stocks. The analysis also helps optimize the management of stock positions to reduce risk when the rally becomes long in the tooth. When market choppiness and corrections intensify, a user will get suggestions on when to cut the position by half. When the market uptrend resumes in bullish fashion or if the stock improves, the analyses note the precise moment in which to turn a half-size position back into a full one.Netflix (NFLX) ranked No. 10 within the IBD 50 at Thursday's close. The online video streaming giant joined the Leaders list of Leaderboard on Dec. 6, 2016, just as it rushed past an early entry point at 120. By February, the stock rose to 145. Leaderboard put a red annotation on the weekly chart, suggesting to take profits as the breakout gain hit the 20% threshold.Those with tons of conviction could, of course, decide to hold longer. Netflix has formed numerous bases since then, but the uptrend has stayed intact. More recently, on April 5, Netflix re-entered the Leaderboard as a half-size position. This made sense, given that market swings have been much more intense vs. 2017. On April 17, Netflix's Leaderboard chart showed a switch to full position following strong Q1 results. But the stock got cut back to half position just five trading sessions later as the stock began to gyrate.The most recent annotation to return to a full position? On April 26, as Netflix held firmly above the 50-day moving average. Institutions were shoring up the stock.Abiomed (ABMD) ranked No. 2 on Thursday. The Leaderboard analysis pointed out that buying back shares at 304.38 was justified, even though the stock had just flipped beneath that proper buy point. Abiomed triggered the golden rule of investing (cut your losses short). Yet it sometimes pays to buy back a good stock a second or third time. You need courage. But if the fundamentals are superior, and the market remains in a confirmed uptrend, you don't want to miss the potential big move.The chart noted how Abiomed has been showing nice buying support near the 10-week moving average. That's a hallmark of great stocks as they make their big price runs.E-Trade Financial (ETFC), also in the top 10, shows a third-stage base count on the annotations in its weekly chart. The higher the base count, the more risk that a breakout will fail. But the online broker continues to show positive action in the RS line and its tendency to hug its 10-week line.Trade the IBD 50 in one click with the Innovator IBD 50 (FFTY) ETF, managed by Innovator Capital. Why are handles an important part of two key chart patterns, the cup with handle and the double bottom?In a nutshell, these visual patterns represent a final significant decline in a stock, setting the stage for a possible surge to new highs.This final shakeout of weak shareholders acts as a verification that selling is done and the stock is ready to advance.The breakout comes when institutional investors start buying like there is no tomorrow. That surge of volume powers the stock to its breakout and larger gains.Here are some basic characteristics of the handle-related chart action to help you know if they're proper or not.First, a handle is a moderate decline lasting at least five days. Most handles require at least a couple of weeks to form. The handle length is generally proportionate to the base. That means the longer the cup, the longer you can expect the handle to be.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseEffective handles drift downward in price in declining trade. The light volume in the handle shows that the final shakeout of weak shareholders is different from intense institutional selling.The handle's decline must be contained. During normal market conditions, handle areas should drop no more than about 8% to 12%.A midpoint of a handle should also form above the midpoint of the highest and lowest prices of the preceding base. To figure the midpoint, add the high and low points for the entire base, then divide by 2. Perform the same calculation for the handle.If the result for the handle's midpoint falls below that of the base, the handle is too low. Maybe that's not a deal killer, but it adds risk.A handle should also form above the stock's 10-week moving average. Research shows that — like handles that form below the base's midpoint — breakouts from handles formed below the 10-week line are failure-prone.The lows in the handle should not drift upward. Such action is called wedging, and it usually leads to failed breakouts.XTO Energy, now owned by Exxon Mobil (XOM), built a complex handle at the end of September 2002.At the time, the Houston-based energy producer was in transition. It had been shifting its focus from oil to natural gas over the past several years. It had just changed its name from Cross-Timbers Oil a year earlier.Shares corrected 28% in a 14-week, double-bottom pattern begun in May 2002 (1).Shares pressed briefly above the buy point on Aug. 19 but reversed to end lower. That was Day No. 1 of what would become a six-week handle (2).Shares drifted lower over the next three weeks — not quite the settled action you'd like to see.On Sept. 10, they pressed to just below the 21.05 buy point in strong trade. This was the break point. The handle settled into picture-perfect action, edging lower in soft volume for the next two weeks (3).Volume soared Sept. 30, followed by the breakout in twice average volume on Oct. 2 (4).Patient investors who bought at that buy point and held on through February 2006 could have made a 128% gain. If they stayed put through June 2008, the gain would have been 250%.(Editor's Note: A version of this column was originally published in the July 8, 2010, edition of IBD.)RELATED:How Can I Determine The Market's Primary Direction: Read This Column FirstThe Basics Of Smart, Profitable Investing: All About The Cup-With-Handle PatternHow To Invest: Why Paycom Software Built A Flawed Cup With Handle PatternHow To Invest: How To Find Advanced Buy PointsStocks Near A Buy Zone

Specialty retailer Ulta Beauty (ULTA) has been quietly undergoing a change.Two statistics describe the change: At the end of fiscal 2014, online sales accounted for about 4% of Ulta's total sales. As of the recent conference call in March, the percentage grew to 12.8%.The tripling is impressive when the investor considers this came while Ulta's overall sales were showing no slowdown from their historically fast pace. Revenue grew 20% to 25% in each of the past seven years.Also, Ulta Beauty continues to add to its physical-store count.At the conference call in March, CEO Mary Dillon noted that Ulta Beauty opened 16 new stores in Q4 and plans to open 100 in 2018. The company has 1,074 stores.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of Use"One area of focus will be our store experience," Dillon said.She explained, "We continue to evolve our store format to respond to guests' rising expectations for an experiential environment."The experiential environment is a key ingredient for many successful retailers. Such stores create an ambience. For retailers such as Sephora, the Apple Store, Whole Foods Market and Pinkberry, the appeal is substance and style.Meanwhile, e-commerce has received a load of attention, even if the industrywide statistics draw a smaller picture than news coverage would suggest.According to the U.S. Census Bureau, e-commerce sales in Q4 accounted for 9.1% of total sales industrywide.In that respect, Ulta's 12.8% weighting in e-commerce sales is bigger than the market's weighting.One area where Ulta Beauty is strong is pretax profit margins. In fiscal 2018, pretax margin was 13.7%, the highest in at least nine years. Pretax margin hit double-digit percentages in 2012 and has stayed in double digits since.Amazon.com (AMZN) is the king of online retail, but the retailer now has a bigger physical-stores footprint than not too long ago.In Q1 2018, Amazon's physical store footprint was about 8.4% of net sales. In the full year 2017, the physical footprint was about 3.3%.Amazon completed the acquisition of Whole Food Markets in August, which boosted Amazon's physical-store sales.Ulta Beauty's stock rose about 33% from October to January. This served as the 30% prior uptrend for Ulta's most recent base. The base is 23% deep and part of a much larger consolidation.The stock has been trying to close above a 249.40 buy point in recent sessions.Amazon's chart is a late-stage story, which carries more risk of failure than an early stage breakout. The stock shaped a short, cup-with-handle base. Although a handle sketched a high at 1568.62, the pattern was too short to be valid.RELATED:Taser's Parent Company Soars7 Ways To Profit From The Trump BumpCan A Great Stock Lead After A Late-Stage Base?

The online advertising services platform reported late Thursday its first-quarter earnings growth accelerated to 89%. Growth in revenue also accelerated for a 61% increase. Both numbers easily topped analyst targets. Management's raised second-quarter and full-year revenue and earnings guidance were well above consensus hurdles.The IPO's opening action marked a breakaway gap, that lifted sharesw well beyond buy range past a 61.03 buy point in a gnarled-looking cup base. Shares remained 50% above their IPO price.Business review site Yelp spilled nearly 9% lower, despite reporting a narrower loss and better revenue growth than expected in its first quarter. The loss ended a six-weekj advance, sending the stock below its 10-week moving average in heavy trade.Energy stocks were largely quiet as crude oil prices traded narrowly lower early Friday. U.S. benchmark West Texas Intermediate was down 0.3%, holding well above $71 per barrel. Crude gained 0.3% Thursday, with WTI settling at $71.36 a barrel, up 2.4% so far for the week. Prices could feel some effect on Friday when Baker Hughes (BHGE) releases its weekly rig-count survey at 1 p.m. ET.Import prices crept up 0.3%, export price jumped 0.6% in April, the Labor Department reported. Economist had expected a 0.5% jump in imports and a smaller, 0.3% rise in export prices.The University of Michigan delivers its preliminary reading on May consumer sentiment at 10 a.m. ET.A glance across Asian stock markets shows Hong Kong's Hang Seng Index rallying more than 1% on Friday. That left the benchmark with a 4% gain for the week, its best since mid-February, as it attempts to climb up from a three-month consolidation. China's Shanghai Composite slipped 0.4% Friday, ending the week with a 2.3% gain. In Japan, the Nikkei 225 in Tokyo capped the week with a 1.2% rally Friday, advancing 1.3% for  its seventh straight weekly gain.Europe's market improved to mixed trade Friday, with Frankfurt's DAX and the CAC-40 in Paris each down more than 0.3% in afternoon trade. London's FTSE 100 fought to hold a fractional gain. For the week, the FTSE 100 is up 1.7%, the DAX ahead 1.2% and the CAC-40 holds a fractional gain. All three indexes are lined up for their seventh straight weekly advances.RELATED:Stock Market Cruises To Good Gains, As Worries RecedeNew Highs Hint At Bullish TrendNvidia Beats First-Quarter Targets On Strong Gaming, Data-Center SalesThese 2 Big China Internet Names Are Rising Fast, in 2 Very Different Bases Apple Extends Win Streak To 9 Days In A Row3D Systems To Print Metal Parts For Warships

Stocks in the REIT Leaders screen rarely make major moves, unless something happens that rocks the industry. That's exactly why Gramercy Property Trust (GPT), a key player in the warehouse REIT field, showed unusual action as it soared 15% Monday.The real estate investment trust agreed to a buyout offer from Blackstone Group (BX) that's valued at $7.6 billion. Affiliates of Blackstone offered $27.50 per share for Gramercy, which owns warehouses in the U.S. and Europe that it leases to companies.Gramercy has been increasing its industrial assets, which are now about 80% of the company's portfolio. The rest covers office space and specialty retail. In 2015, less than half of the properties were industrial. Buildings are in major metropolitan areas such as Chicago, Los Angeles, Atlanta and Dallas.The growth of online commerce has expanded the need for warehousing and logistics. Last year, Gramercy announced a joint venture to acquire and manage distribution centers specifically for online retailing, where demand for warehouse space is strong.In a presentation last month, Gramercy said some of its largest tenants are FedEx (FDX), gym operator Life Time Fitness, Bank of America (BAC) and Amazon.com (AMZN).Last month, logistics company Prologis (PLD) agreed to acquire logistics real estate company DCT Industrial Trust for $8.4 billion, including debt. DCT owns 71 million square feet of space.The deal underscores demand for warehousing space, and suggests other deals may be coming.Blackstone and Gramercy have both been in IBD's Dividend Leaders and REIT Leaders screens thanks to solid dividend yields and dividend growth rates.Blackstone has an annualized dividend yield of nearly 7%. The firm is one of the largest investment advisory and management firms in the world.RELATED:Athenahealth Confirms Takeover Bid; IFF, Blackstone Clinch DealsTop Dividend Company Aims For Online-Retail WarehousesInside Big Cap 20

A longtime Wall Street analyst who has watched his bull case for General Electric (GE) unravel fessed up to being wrong on GE stock in a note to clients Monday."The bears won. The game is over," wrote Melius Research's Scott Davis, who has researched industrial equities for 25 years, including prior stints at Barclays and Morgan Stanley.Davis expressed embarrassment at "being associated as a bull in the worst-performing stock of the year."Nonetheless, he reaffirmed a buy rating on GE stock and a price target of 27, arguing that a breakup of the iconic company would boost valuations.Shares rose 1.4% to 14.27 on the stock market today, They have been straddling the 50-day moving average since the industrial giant's earnings and revenue beat in April. Among GE's Dow Jones peers, United Technologies (UTX) and 3M (MMM), advanced 0.7%.. Honeywell (HON) rose 7 cents to 144.23. Siemens (SIEGY) climbed 0.4%.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseHere are the lessons Davis learned from the mistake that he now owns up to:While GE management "explained away" degrading contract terms with customers, cash flow was a red flag, Davis said. Margins on industrial free cash flow went from 7.1% in 2015 to 4.8% in 2017."When down payments decrease, final payments don't match up with product delivery, and receivables grow faster than revenue, there is usually a problem," Davis added.Although he sees early signs of improvement in GE's cash flows, a fix for the "deep" hole the industrial giant is in will take time.Warning signals included a disproportionate rise in risk tolerance and M&A deals outside GE's historical scope to questionable compensation packages and a dismissive attitude toward those who questioned the company, Davis said.He believes the creation at GE of "smaller, more focused entities that can build their own cultures" may repair the problem.The conglomerate's 18-member board under former CEO Jeff Immelt lacked experience in many of the areas where the conglomerate was making a big push — such as software and emerging markets, Davis said. Many also lacked expertise in core GE segments such as power generation, aviation and health care, he added.Now Davis is of the view that "an unusually large number of board members" is among the key signs of weak governance, along with lack of diversity and lack of talent in technology, especially software.The $143 million in fees for auditor KPMG can lead to potential conflict of interest and bad behavior, Davis said. It's now clear to him that "the audit cost alone indicates a company that is way too complex" — and the company's recent, delayed financial restatement has not allayed that fear. The late filing is another sign of complexity, he added.Davis had a turnaround thesis on GE last year, but later concluded that new CEO John Flannery had "failed to see the depths of the company's problems and he had too much to fix for any one person to handle."Davis noted that Flannery has been in charge almost a year now and "we haven't seen much." But he also noted that turnarounds that initially looked like they would take two years ended up taking three to five years at other companies.Davis admits his earnings model badly missed the "the fast degradation in power markets and lack of recovery in oil/gas."And he had recommended the stock "while not fully understanding the risk in the insurance business" and underestimating its complexity.YOU MIGHT BE INTERESTED IN:GE Dividend Looks Safer On This Good News; Stock Tops Key LevelIf General Electric Breaks Up, Should You Break Up With GE's Stock?From Boeing To GE, Companies Eye Trump's Decision On Iran Nuclear Deal

Recent volatility on Wall Street may have spooked some investors, but money manager Rob Lutts is looking ahead to further upside.He says he is "pretty bullish" on all equity markets, though he favors foreign and emerging markets due to their much lower valuations. And on the domestic front, he believes the S&P 500 will rise to 3000 by the end of this year."We think many are underestimating the positive impact of eight years of extreme monetary stimulus," Lutts, founder, president and chief investment officer of Cabot Wealth Management, told IBD. "We love that many professionals are now calling for a 5%-10% correction. I believe we completed the corrective phase a few weeks ago ... a nice summer rally will pave the way for higher returns."Salem, Mass.-based Cabot, with more than $600 million in assets, uses exchange traded funds to help build client portfolios. Here, in his own words, are Lutts' three best ETF picks for the months ahead:KraneShares Bosera MSCI China A (KBA)We believe the China growth story is misunderstood. Many investors know Alibaba (BABA), Ctrip.com (CTRP), Baidu (BIDU) and Tencent (TCEHY) and how these have been great growth companies in China. The valuations of these growth darlings are now a bit elevated and thus have less immediate upside.So what is the best way to invest in China today? We believe the A share market is much more attractive from a valuation perspective and has exposure to many lesser known growth companies. KraneShares put this fund together to track the companies that will be included in the MSCI Emerging Markets Index starting June 1, 2018. China A shares will be a small position initially on June 1, 2018 — it will comprise a little less than 1% of the MSCI EEM Index. Over time it will increase — some estimate that if the China A market had 100% inclusion into the MSCI EEM market, it would be 13% of the Index. Today, the KBA fund has an attractive P/E of only 14 times 12-month trailing earnings and a dividend yield approaching 2% annually.The Chinese economy continues to drive global growth and investors should not ignore this part of the world. China's growth will continue due to continued urbanization, transportation improvements and higher internet penetration, manufacturing growth and expansion of the financial sector. The China growth story is still very much alive. KBA is a fine way to get exposure to the world's fastest-growing large economy.Guggenheim Solar Index (TAN)The time for solar energy is now. Why? The economics of solar are quickly becoming a lower-cost choice than coal and oil and natural gas power plants. The key difference is that a solar system has one upfront cost and then no fuel costs, and your costs are fixed for the coming 25 to 30 years. Your fuel cost (the sun) of course, is free and your cost will never increase. Maintenance is very modest and the cost of manufacturing and installing solar continues to decline rapidly.We were told recently by a representative of First Solar (FSLR), which is 8% of the TAN ETF, that First Solar's large-scale utility systems can now produce (all-in cost) power for 4-6 cents per kilowatt hour. This is of course very competitive when compared to coal and even natural gas, which can be as high as 7-10 cents per kWh. We believe in many markets solar is now the lowest-cost choice for power generation.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseWhy this ETF? The top five positions are all the leading providers of solar power globally. We have seen projections by the International Energy Association (IEA) in their 2017 Annual Report that they expect the total installed global cumulative installations to go from 425 gigawatts (GWs) to more than 1,000 GW over the next five years. They expect more than 575 GWs will be installed globally in the coming five years. We expect First Solar, Xinyi solar, Sunrun (RUN), Scatar Solar USA and SunPower (SPWR) will all grab a large piece of this new market. These are all in the top six holdings of the fund. The second-largest position in the fund is the leading energy converter — Solar Edge Technologies (SEDG). The time for solar is now — put some of this in your portfolio today.Global X MSCI Nigeria (NGE)Nigeria is an economy with huge potential, driven in large part by its young population. Forty-two percent of Nigeria's population is between 0-14 years of age. The median age of the population in Nigeria is 18. Why is this important? A young population is the engine of growth in an economy. Nigeria has many other problems that are well known (governance, corruption, and legal); thus, there are challenges to the thesis of investing in Nigeria.The current valuations of the fund are some of the cheapest in the world, with an average price-earnings ratio (P/E) of 8 and a dividend yield of 4.5%. These valuations, of course, have discounted a great deal of these challenges. We know of many banks that trade in Nigeria with a P/E multiple of 4-5 times earnings and carry dividend yields of 9%-10% (this valuation is about 25% of the average bank that trades in the United States).Nigeria now runs largely on the power of generators — there is a lack of power throughout the country — many businesses must generate their own power. It has been estimated that 45% of businesses run their own generators to operate their companies. One reason for the valuation discount is the lack of liquidity in Nigeria. The whole stock market of Nigeria trades a total of approximately $1 million-$1.5 million or so of volume per day. So establishing a position in Nigeria is difficult for an institution of any size. For this reason, we would recommend only smaller positions in Nigeria. The Global X ETF is a great way to invest in Nigeria.YOU MAY ALSO BE INTERESTED IN:Can The S&P 500 Shake Off Market Volatility And Go Past 3000?7 Ways To Profit From This Surging Sector's Trump BumpShould You Bank On Bank Stocks As The Fed Raises Rates?

The Dow Jones and S&P 500 reclaimed their 50-day moving average. Crude oil rose above $71 a barrel and energy stocks such as Chevron (CVX) kept rising after President Trump pulled out from the Iran nuclear deal. Walmart (WMT) will buy 77% of Flipkart with a $16 billion investment. Nvidia (NVDA) crushed earnings views. Several top software makers broke out on earnings. China internets had mixed results, while solar stocks shined on earnings and new regulation.XThe S&P 500, Dow Jones industrial average and Nasdaq composite rallied strongly, rising 2.4%, 2.3% and 2.7%, respectively. The S&P 500 and Dow joined the Nasdaq above their 50-day moving averages. Breakouts proliferated, including several oil, payments and software stocks.President Trump announced the U.S. would leave the nuclear deal and the global oil markets could lose 500,000 barrels per day of Iranian crude next year if all the sanctions are reinstituted. Crude, which had rallied strongly leading up to the announcement, topped $71 a barrel after the decision. Crude closed the week up 1.4% at $70.70. The Energy Information Administration now sees 2018 U.S. crude output averaging 10.72 million barrels per day, up 0.3% from a prior forecast, and sees 2019 output averaging 11.86 million barrels a day, a 3.6% upward revision. The EIA said weekly crude inventories fell by 2.2 million barrels last week, more than analysts forecast. Domestic crude output climbed to 10.7 million barrels per day. Occidental Petroleum (OXY) announced strong Q1 earnings and buyback plans. Diamondback Energy (FANG) Q1 results also beat analyst estimates. Oil majors Chevron (CVX) and Royal Dutch Shell (RDSA) cleared buy points.Green Dot (GDOT), which provides prepaid cards and other financial products, soared past a buy point on strong earnings. Payments tech company Worldpay (WP) beat Q1 estimates, but its outlook appeared to disappoint Wall Street, pushing shares away from buying territory. Visa (V), and Square (SQ) remained within buy range, moving to the high end of the range. Mastercard (MA) is slightly extending. Payments processor Global Payments (GPN) made its way through a base.Graphics-chip maker Nvidia smashed Wall Street's targets for its fiscal first quarter thanks to strong gaming and data-center chip sales. Nvidia earned $1.98 a share, up 151% year over year, on sales of $3.21 billion, up 66%. For the current quarter, its Q2, Nvidia expects sales to rise 39% to $3.1 billion, edging views of $2.97 billion. But it sees a big drop in cryptocurrency chip sales. Shares fell 2.15% Friday after rallying to a new high ahead of its earnings. Microchip Technology (MCHP) beat consensus for the March quarter and guided current-quarter views slightly higher.SolarEdge (SEDG) surged as the solar power company reported strong first-quarter earnings and gave bullish guidance. SolarEdge will enter the multibillion dollar market for uninterruptible power supply systems, by agreeing to buy Gamatronic Electronic. Solar stocks rallied across the board, including SunPower (SPWR) and Sunrun (RUN), after California became the first state to require solar panels on almost all new homes.Walmart (WMT) has beaten Amazon (AMZN) in their battle for control of Flipkart by agreeing to pay $16 billion for a 77% stake in the Indian e-commerce giant, which was founded by ex-Amazon employees. Walmart says it's a "significant opportunity" to partner with the local leader in a large, fast-growing market. But Walmart's slumping stock fell to a seven-month low. Walmart's largest-ever acquisition requires regulatory approval in India.Social network Weibo (WB) and parent Sina (SINA) topped first-quarter earnings estimates, but both stocks suffered double-digit losses. E-commerce company JD.com (JD) received price target cuts following a quarterly report that fell short of Wall Street estimates, though revenue beat. China auto website provider Autohome (ATHM) reported better-than-expected earnings and also nudged second-quarter revenue forecasts higher, sending the stock up.Online travel company Booking Holdings (BKNG), formerly Priceline, plunged as it reported quarterly results that beat views but gave an outlook that missed estimates, as the company makes ongoing changes to its marketing strategy. TripAdvisor (TRIP) soared after delivering a first-quarter report above consensus and raising 2018 guidance on stronger mobile monetization.New Relic (NEWR), Pegasystems (PEGA), Cornerstone OnDemand (CSOD) all broke out on earnings reports, with Upland Software (UPLD) and HubSpot (HUBS) flirting with a buy zone. RingCentral (RNG) moved above a buy range on results.New Relic, whose cloud software lets companies monitor business applications, servers and mobile applications, swung to a 9-cent profit, vs. views for 5 cents, with revenue up 34% to $98.4 million and billings up 43%. Pegasystems earnings fell more than expected, but the customer service software maker's revenue topped. Cornerstone OnDemand earnings grew 75% with revenue up 19% to $133 million. Upland, which makes software for project and information technology management, workflow automation, and digital engagement, reported that adjusted profit leapt 131% and revenue 52%. HubSpot profit spiked 400% while 2018 EPS guidance was strong. RingCentral said that adjusted earnings were 16 cents a share, up 77% from a year ago, with revenue rising 34% to $150 million. Its cloud communications platform offers customers voice, chat, conferencing and app integration.LGI Homes (LGIH) EPS jumped 115% as revenue popped 71% to $279 million, both much better than views. But shares reversed sharply lower as the entry-level homebuilders said costs were rising. Meanwhile, simulated-wood decking products maker Trex (TREX) and building materials firm TopBuild (BLD) broke out on strong earnings. Real estate website operator Zillow (Z) rose for the week after initially tumbling following its earnings beat.Comcast (CMCSA) has reportedly thrown its hat into the ring in a bid for 21st Century Fox (FOXA) entertainment assets with a $60 billion bid, trying to trump a Walt Disney (DIS) deal. Disney's studio revenue popped 21% in Q2, as overall revenue at the media giant rose 7% to $14.23 billion and EPS grew 12% to $1.68, topping views. "Black Panther" was a highlight. The theme parks unit grew 13%. Disney said its ESPN+ streaming service is off to a good start. Meanwhile, 21st Century Fox EPS fell 9% to 49 cents a share, missing estimates, on a 2% revenue slip to $7.42 billion, above views.Dropbox (DBX) earned an adjusted 8 cents a share, up from 2 cents a year ago, doubling estimates of 4 cents in its first quarterly report since its March IPO. Revenue rose 28% to $316 million, beating estimates of $267 million. The provider of data-storage and business-collaboration services forecast June quarter and 2018 revenue slightly above estimates.Takeda Pharmaceuticals put up a winning $62 billion bid to buy rare-disease specialist Shire (SHPG) in a deal expected to close in the first half of 2019.Ligand Pharmaceuticals (LGND) reported adjusted income of $1.55 per share on $56.2 million in sales, rising a respective 172% and 92% year over year to top views.Etsy (ETSY) reported first-quarter results that topped views and showed improving fundamentals, with the e-commerce site's growth accelerating and margin expanding as it raised 2018 guidance.Planet Fitness (PLNT) topped first-quarter estimates, but costs rose and the fitness chain didn't raise guidance. Shares fell nearly 5% Wednesday but were up 0.1% for the week.SailPoint (SAIL) reported adjusted Q1 earnings and revenue that beat expectations but in-line guidance for the June quarter disappointed, sending shares in the cybersecurity firm down. SailPoint sells identity management software that helps companies monitor security breaches.GoDaddy (GDDY) reported Q1 profit that met views as revenue and free cash flow beat, sending shares up. Analysts expect the web hosting and internet domain registering company to use growing FCF for acquisitions and to expand internationally.Trade Desk (TTD) earned 34 cents a share, up 88%, on revenue of $85.7 million, up 61%, blasting past views for 10 cents and $73.2 million. The online ad tech firm forecast Q2 revenue of $103 million vs. estimates of $95 million. Shares vaulted 43% on Friday.Video game publisher Electronic Arts (EA) reported better-than-expected results for its fiscal fourth quarter thanks to strength in key franchises such as "FIFA," "Battlefield" and "The Sims."Streaming video platform Roku (ROKU) delivered a beat-and-raise first-quarter report on gains in advertising-supported internet video channels. Roku ended the quarter with 20.8 million active accounts, up 1.5 million from the end of 2017, but shares fell.Zebra Technologies (ZBRA), a maker of asset tracking systems, trounced expectations for first-quarter sales and earnings and guided analysts up for the current quarter, sending its stock soaring.Starbucks (SBUX) will get $7.15 billion up-front from Nestle, which will sell Starbucks products around the world. Starbucks will use the cash to accelerate share buybacks and return $20 billion in cash to shareholders via buybacks and dividends.

Eli Lilly (LLY) is trying to "leapfrog" Dow Jones stock Merck (MRK) and Bristol-Myers Squibb (BMY) with its $1.6 billion acquisition of cancer immunotherapy biotech Armo Biosciences (ARMO), an industry observer said Thursday.Drugmaker Lilly is late to the game in cancer immunotherapy, Brad Loncar told Investor's Business Daily. Loncar runs several biotech stock indexes including the Cancer Immunotherapy Sector Index, which contains Armo. The Loncar Cancer Immunotherapy exchange-traded fund popped 3.6% Thursday."The leaders are Merck and Bristol-Myers Squibb and Roche (RHHBY)," he said. "If you're a company that has completely missed the boat and you want to play in this area, you have to do something to try to leapfrog the competition."Early Thursday, Lilly made its first big move in the cancer immunotherapy space — an area of medicine in which drugs teach the immune system to fight cancer. Lilly said it would pay $50 per share of Armo in an all-cash deal.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseArmo shares rocketed 67% to close at 49.80, as Lilly stock rose 2% to 80.86. Fellow drug stocks, like Merck and Bristol, both rose less than 1%. Roche, which had a failure early in the day in colon cancer, dipped 1.6% to 27.63.Lilly expects the deal to close by the end of the second quarter. Armo, a late-stage biotech, went public at 17 in January and quickly popped. It was a "hot" initial public offering, Loncar said, noting that its price early Thursday indicates investors may expect another bid on it.Leerink analyst Jonathan Chang noted that the acquisition price is a 68% premium over Armo's closing price Wednesday. He initiated coverage of the stock with an outperform rating and 50 price target earlier in the year. On Thursday, he downgraded Armo to market perform."The deal confirms our investment thesis on Armo and, in our view, could read positively to other emerging immuno-oncology stocks," he said. "It is unclear if other bidders will emerge, given (the) short closing date."The acquisition makes sense as pharmaceutical stock Lilly tries to assert itself in the cancer immunotherapy space, Loncar said. Armo's lead drug, called pegilodecakin, is known as a cytokine. It boosts the strength of drugs known as PD-1 inhibitors, like Merck's Keytruda and Bristol's Opdivo.Earlier this year, Bristol validated another cytokine drug called NKTR-214 by paying $1.85 billion upfront to partner with Nektar Therapeutics (NKTR) on it. The deal hit a record for an upfront payment in biotech, Loncar said. Now, it's of little surprise that Armo is to be taken out.Loncar has consistently predicted that 2018 would be a big year for biotech deals, mergers and takeouts. The year kicked off with news of Celgene's (CELG) plan to buy Juno Therapeutics and Sanofi's (SNY) bids on Bioverativ (BIVV) and Ablynx (ABLX).But this deal for Armo is a little different, he said."I think this one would have happened if we were in the middle of a terrible, bear market," he said. On the other hand, "this is also a good example of large companies like Eli Lilly, many of them have not been at the forefront of innovation and they're having to buy into that."Still, Lilly isn't alone in its trailing position in cancer immunotherapy. Roche, AstraZeneca (AZN) and Pfizer (PFE) all have immuno-oncology drugs, but remain behind Merck and Bristol which are "on a level of their own," he said.The cancer immunotherapy space desperately needed some good news, he said. Earlier this year, Incyte's (INCY) drug, known as an IDO inhibitor, failed in a late-stage combination with Merck's Keytruda in melanoma. Incyte's pain extended to other cancer immunotherapy stocks.Background volatility remains in the cancer immunotherapy space, Loncar said. The key, he said, is that these are all different pieces of technology. The Armo drug is different from the Incyte drug known as epacadostat."Every news item sets people's moods," he said. "Everybody is down on immunotherapy and thinks it's overrated. Then a deal like this happens and it causes the opposite reaction. Whenever you have an emerging technology like this it's going to be a roller coaster."RELATED:Chart-Reading Basics: How A Buy Point Marks A Time Of Real OpportunityHow To Tame A Volatile Swing Trade With A Half PositionLooking For The Next Nvidia? Start With This Simple Routine

Dow Jones futures rallied Wednesday morning along with S&P 500 futures and Nasdaq futures, as crude oil prices rebounded solidly a day after President Donald Trump pulled the U.S. out of the Iran nuclear deal. Meanwhile, the 10-year U.S. Treasury yield moved back above 3%.Despite concerns about the stock market and geopolitical impact, the Dow Jones, S&P 500 index and Nasdaq composite closed virtually unchanged Tuesday after Trump's Iran decision. Most top stocks in buy range continued to act well, with Apple (AAPL), Nvidia (NVDA), Visa (V) and Mastercard (MA) nudging higher.Crude oil prices fell, but pared losses and held near multiyear highs Tuesday.Dow Jones futures rose 0.5% vs. fair value. S&P 500 futures climbed 0.45%. Nasdaq 100 futures were 0.35% higher.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseU.S. crude futures rose 2.7% to $70.95 a barrel, hitting their best levels since late 2014.The 10-year Treasury yield just topped 3%, hitting 3.006%, after peaking at 3.02% in late April. Meanwhile, the 2-year yield climbed to 2.52%, putting the spread at a still-narrow 48 basis points. That 3% yield, and the narrowing Treasury yield spread with the 2-year rate, pressured stock markets.Tuesday's stock market action held three key investing lessons. 1. Don't be swayed by outside noise and punditry; focus on the action of the major stock market averages and leading stocks. 2. The 50-day moving average looms large for the Dow Jones, S&P 500 and Nasdaq composite. 3. Pay close attention to the relative strength line, which tracks a stock's performance vs. the S&P 500 index. The RS line is an easy way to separate true stock market winners from laggards.Investors should stay in tune with important business, political, economic and technology news and trends. That can inform your investing decisions. But your primary focus and investing guide should be the action of the major indexes — the S&P 500, Nasdaq composite and Dow Jones industrial average — and the action of leading stocks.President Trump's decision on the Iran nuclear deal drew a lot of attention, and deservedly so. But ultimately, the collective wisdom of investors decided for now that Trump's decision to exit that accord was not a market-moving event. The Dow Jones and Nasdaq composite just inched higher in stock market trading Tuesday, while the S&P 500 index edged lower.Meanwhile, most recent breakouts fared well. Tech giants Apple and Nvidia rose fractionally, outperforming the broader market. Top oil stocks like Marathon Oil (MRO) acted bullishly, paring intraday losses or even gaining despite a modest loss for crude futures.The 50-day is often a key area of support for leading stocks as well as the major indexes. But it can also act as resistance. Since late January, the S&P 500 index and Dow Jones have struggled to move above the 50-day line, with the few attempts short-lived. Both indexes are just below the 50-day currently, though futures Wednesday suggest they may make another run at that level.The Nasdaq composite reclaimed that level on Friday and is holding just above that line.Investors should always focus on the true stock market leaders. If you're going to take on stock-specific risk, you want to get outperformance. But in conditions like now, when the stock market uptrend is under pressure, besting the S&P 500 simply is a must.Apple, Nvidia, Mastercard and Visa all rose fractionally, moving higher but still within their 5% buy zones. While the price gains were modest, the RS lines all hit long-term or all-time highs. Marathon Oil fell intraday to 19.15 before roaring back for a 3.4% gain at 20.44, extended from an 18.76 buy point. The RS line set a 15-month best.YOU MIGHT BE INTERESTED IN:The Big Picture: Indexes Resilient After Trump DecisionThe Big Squeeze: New Risks For Fed Interest Rates, Recession And Yield CurvePure Storage, 58.com Are Buys; These 3 Top Stocks Are Setting Up In Same Bullish PatternTrump Scraps Iran Nuclear Deal, But With This CaveatThree Internets, Hot Oil Stock Report Earnings Wednesday; This One Is Near A BuyThese Four Leading Stocks Broke Out Past Buy Points Tuesday

Graphics-chip maker Nvidia (NVDA) beat first-quarter financial targets thanks in part to sales of chips used for mining cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ethereum. But it expects a big drop in such sales for the current quarter.Nvidia shares fell 2.2% to close at 254.53 on the stock market today. On Thursday, Nvidia notched an all-time high of 260.50. It broke out of a seven-week double-bottom base at a buy point of 239.35 on Monday.Late Thursday, Nvidia posted fiscal first-quarter results that crushed Wall Street's expectations. It earned $1.98 a share, up 151% year over year, on sales of $3.21 billion, up 66%, for the quarter ended April 29. Analysts expected $1.47 and $2.91 billion, according to Zacks Investment Research.On a conference call with analysts, Nvidia executives revealed that the company sold $289 million in graphics processing units to cryptocurrency miners in the first quarter. But they expect crypto sales to fall by about two-thirds in the current quarter.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of Use"Crypto miners bought a lot of our GPUs in the quarter and it drove prices up," Chief Executive Jensen Huang said. "I think that a lot of gamers weren't able to buy into the new GeForce as a result."Crypto chip sales made up about 9% of Nvidia's total sales last quarter. Analysts had modeled for about $200 million in crypto sales in the first quarter.Nvidia's cryptocurrency-related revenue is expected to fall 66% to $96 million in the second quarter, Chief Financial Officer Colette Kress said.Strong sales of graphics processors for gaming PCs and data centers also buoyed first-quarter results.Investors shouldn't obsess about the crypto business, Rosenblatt Securities analyst Hans Mosesmann said. He notes that the biggest drivers for Nvidia are chips for data centers and artificial intelligence applications."The crypto thing is no longer a relevant bear theme," Mosesmann said in a note to clients. "Get over it."Nvidia is a key player in transitioning data centers to graphics processing units from central processing units, he said.Mosesmann reiterated his buy rating on Nvidia and raised his price target to 315 from 300.Needham analyst Rajvindra Gill maintained his buy rating and upped his price target to 325 from 300."While we acknowledge the valuation is high compared to the rest of the semi group, we can't find another chip company where revenue has doubled in three years and earnings have grown about 5 (times), all organically," he said in a report. Gill expects data-center and autonomous-driving markets to continue to provide robust growth.RELATED:Nvidia Beats First-Quarter Targets On Strong Gaming, Data-Center Sales

Intel (INTC), Apple (AAPL) and other big-cap techs boosted key market index funds Thursday, while Bitcoin soared.PowerShares QQQ Trust (QQQ) and SPDR Dow Jones Industrial Average (DIA) each closed 1.2% higher, while SPDR S&P 500 (SPY) added 0.8% in the stock market today. Foreign markets underperformed by comparison as iShares MSCI Emerging Markets (EEM) finished fractionally lower and iShares MSCI EAFE (EFA) climbed 0.4%.Intel, up 3.2%, was the biggest mover on the Dow 30. Cisco (CSCO) rose 2.1%, Microsoft (MSFT) and IBM (IBM) nearly 2% each and Apple, 1%. Cisco regained its 50-day moving average for the first time in two weeks.Apple is now 2% above its 50-day line, where it had met resistance for much of the prior three weeks. Shares may be working on a flat base with a potential 183.60 buy point. The iPhone maker's Apple Music subscription services passed 40 million subscribers, according to a Wednesday report.Banks, semiconductors and biotechs were among the top sector fund gainers, while homebuilders, gold miners and utilities lagged. Gold commodity ETFs fell along with a 1.3% drop in gold futures to about $1,335 an ounce. SPDR Gold Shares (GLD) and iShares Gold Trust (IAU) slid 1.2% each.But Bitcoin leapt 11% to $7,697.98, according to CoinDesk, after rising past $8,000 intraday. Bitcoin Investment Trust (GBTC) gapped up and rose 9% to shoot past its 200-day line. The precise catalyst for the price jump remained unclear, but the unwinding of Bitcoin short trades may have been a factor.If you like the FANG stocks and believe in the power of cloud computing, here's an exchange traded fund you might consider.First Trust Cloud Computing (SKYY) regained its 50-day moving average this week after spending most of the past two weeks below the line. If it can make a convincing move above the line, that would mark a potential buy opportunity. We last featured SKYY in this ETF column on Oct. 24.The $1.3 billion fund, which turns seven years old in July, tracks the ISE Cloud Computing Index. The index is composed of stocks with a market cap of at least $100 million that fit into one of three categories: pure-play cloud computing, non-pure-play cloud computing, and technology-conglomerate cloud computing — all companies that support or indirectly use cloud-computing technology.Stocks are equally weighted in each of the three categories. Software accounted for the biggest sector exposure as of Tuesday, at roughly 38% of assets. Internet software and services contributed 15%, communications equipment 14%, internet and direct-marketing retail 12%, and technology hardware, storage and peripherals 10%.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseNetflix , Akamai Technologies (AKAM), Red Hat (RHT), Amazon and NetApp (NTAP) made up the top five holdings, which represented 27% of the 30-stock portfolio. Top growth stock IPG Photonics (IPGP) was a new addition to the IBD Sector Leaders list late Thursday. IPG was one of the top stocks of 2017, but that strength hasn't persisted into 2018. But that may be set to change, as the stock nears a proper buy point in the stock market today.Early May 1, the company reported better-than-expected first-quarter earnings, resulting in a 9.5% advance. The stock found much-needed support at its 200-day line.In that quarter, adjusted earnings and sales growth came in at 40% and 26%, respectively, vs. the year-ago period. But that growth is a step down from the torrid levels of growth two quarters ago. Then, the company posted year-over-year profit and revenue growth of 64% and 48%, respectively.Analysts expect the firm's full-year earnings to grow 17% in 2018 and 11% in 2019.According to analysts at Bernstein, IPG is the dominant player among fiber lasers and its competitive edge is expanding. Lasers continue to replace conventional cutting tools. With lower costs, lasers have become more attractive for all manufacturers, not just the larger ones.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseBernstein has an outperform rating on the stock and a 294 price target — about 17% higher than Friday's midday price.The Elec-Scientific/Measuring industry is ranked a middling No. 82 out of 197 groups. Within the group, IPG is the No. 3 stock with a 95 out of a highest-possible 99 IBD Composite Rating. The rating is a blend of key fundamental and technical metrics.Shares of the laser maker are nearing a late-stage double-bottom base's 260.72 buy point amid the stock's current two-week win streak. Keep in mind that later-stage base formations are more likely to fail than earlier-stage bases.The stock is about 4% away from the potential entry.According to the IBD Stock Checkup, IPG has a B- Accumulation/Distribution Rating and a strong 2.2 up/down volume ratio. The neutral up/down volume ratio is 1.0.RELATED:Inside Investor's Corner: What To Do When A Stock Gaps Up And Past The Normal Buy PointSector Leaders Highlight Best Growth Stocks; IPG Photonics Added To ListApple Services Called 'Next Paradigm Shift' For Company's StockBitcoin Plunges Ahead Of Blockchain Week; Facebook Eyes CryptocurrenciesCan A Great Stock Lead Again After Forming A Late-Stage Base? U.S. stocks sold off Monday on the first trading day of the second quarter as China fired a new salvo in the emerging conflict on bilateral trade between the world's two largest economies. The Dow Jones industrials closed the day off 1.9%. The blue-chip index clipped its 200-day moving average for the first time since late June of 2016.Meanwhile, traders sought to bargain hunt in digital currencies and related securities as Bitcoin rallied 2.5% to $6,948, according to data from Coindesk.com. Bitcoin Investment Trust (GBTC) stopped a six-day selling streak, rising more than 6% to 11.15. Volume was thin, though, and the popular closed-end fund still lies below its long-term 200-day moving average.At 71% below a 52-week and all-time peak of 38.75, Bitcoin Investment Trust is still deep in a correction. The fourth-quarter climax run indicates that Bitcoin will need a lot of time before strong buying stabilizes prices and the balance of supply vs. demand tips to the latter.The Dow saw at least half of its 30 components lose 2 points or more. At the session's low of 23,344, the 30-stock Dow Jones industrial average fell 12% below its all-time peak of 26,616. That's a big enough decline to call it an intermediate-level correction.In a healthy stock market, the major indexes trade above both the 50- and 200-day moving averages.The S&P 500 dropped 2.2% as all but two of IBD's 197 industry groups fell for the day. The Nasdaq composite, hurt by big sell-offs in all of the FAANG stocks, slumped more than 2.7%. At one point, the leading U.S. equities index fell to as low as 6805 but maintained a small air pocket above its 200-day line.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseRetail internet, auto retailing, automaker, biotech, airline, movie and U.S. oil and gas exploration stocks sold off the hardest, each down more than 3%. WTI crude oil futures sank 2.8% to $63.13 a barrel.NVR (NVR), the luxury homebuilder, helped push the residential construction industry group to a small gain but most top-rated members in the group fell. NVR rose 4% to 2,922 but has been spending considerable time beneath the 50-day moving average.Industry group mate LGI Homes (LGIH) sank more than 5% to 66.59 in volume that was only slightly above average. The IBD 50 member has been crafting the right side of a new cuplike pattern. Watch to see if the small-cap stock can stay on the north side of its 50-day moving average.The S&P SmallCap 600 fell more than 2.5% but has yet to challenge its 200-day moving average, which continues to rise.LGI sports the best Composite Rating of 95 (on a scale of 1 to 99) within IBD's Building-Residential/Commercial industry group, as seen in IBD Stock Checkup. The Texas-based  homebuilder, which saw a 62% rise in home closings to 1,844 in the fourth quarter, also saw a 5.6% increase in average home sales price vs. a year ago.RELATED:Stocks Near A Buy ZoneWhat Direction Is The Stock Market Headed? Netflix (NFLX) stock closed below its 50-day moving average on Monday in a bearish technical trading sign.Shares of the internet television network had fallen below that key support level in the previous two trading sessions, but managed to close above it on both days. However, on the stock market today, shares closed below their 50-day moving average for the first time this year amid a broad market sell-off. Netflix fell 5.1% to 280.29 on Monday. In intraday trading it had been down as much as 6.9% to 275.05.The stock has fallen 16% from its all-time high of 333.98 on March 12, though it's still well-extended from a 204.48 flat-base entry. Netflix currently ranks No. 3 on the IBD 50 list of top-performing growth stocks.Wall Street analysts have debated the company's valuation of late following its steep run-up. Bulls point to healthy subscriber growth, massive global scale and strong brand. Bears bring up its heavy spending on content, large negative free cash flow and growing competition.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseEarlier Monday, Baird analyst William Power reiterated his neutral rating on Netflix, but upped his price target to 280 from 240. Power said the risk/reward on Netflix stock is balanced due to "continued high expectations and valuation."The company has built a catalog of exclusive, original content as Hollywood studios increasingly look to create their own direct-to-consumer streaming video services. Its competition now includes Amazon (AMZN), Hulu and Time Warner's (TWX) HBO, but Walt Disney (DIS) and Apple (AAPL) are set to join the fray soon.Netflix reportedly is interested in buying French movie studio EuropaCorp, best known for such films as "Taken," "Lucy" and "Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets." A deal could be announced in the next few weeks, according to French media reports. EuropaCorp has a market cap of about $80 million.The next catalyst for Netflix stock is likely to be its first-quarter earnings report, scheduled for release after the market close on April 16.RELATED:IQiyi, The Netflix Of China, Begins Trading — And Then FallsQ1 Earnings: Who Joins Netflix, Twitter On List Of Stocks Expecting 50%-Plus Growth?Netflix Said To Seek News Content, Gets A Price-Target Hike

When it comes to business, there are few overnight successes. Building a company into a thriving enterprise is a step-by-step process that takes many years, if not decades. That's why perseverance is typically a trait of great leadership. As the perseverance quotes below indicate, the key to success is continuing to chase your long-term goals, even when faced with opposition or difficulties. This is true even for the most gifted of CEOs and business professionals.So, whether you are looking to achieve an important corporate milestone or reach the next rung on your own career ladder, let these famous quotes about perseverance inspire you to keep moving forward.I am not smarter than anybody else, but I can outwork you.
Michael Bloomberg, businessmanSuccess seems to be connected to action. Successful people keep moving. They make mistakes, but they don't quit.
Conrad Hilton, hotelierA hungry dog hunts best. A hungrier dog hunts even better.
Norman Augustine, former CEO, Lockheed MartinI have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
Thomas Edison, inventorFailure is only an opportunity to begin again more intelligently.
Henry Ford, industrialistThe most entrepreneurial trait there is: the ability to persist.

Steve Chou, author/entrepreneurGet these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseIn every battle there comes a time when both sides consider themselves beaten, then he who continues the attack wins.
Ulysses S. Grant, 18th U.S. presidentSuccess is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
Winston Churchill, British prime ministerI've got a woman's ability to stick to a job and get on with it when everyone else walks off and leaves it.
Margaret Thatcher, British prime ministerThe only use of an obstacle is to be overcome. All that an obstacle does with brave men is, not to frighten them, but to challenge them.
Woodrow Wilson, 28th U.S. presidentThere are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work and learning from failure.
Colin Powell, U.S. Army general and secretary of stateThe only lost cause is one we give up on before we enter the struggle.
Vaclav Havel, Czech statesman and writerObstacles don't have to stop you. If you run into a wall, don't turn around and give up. Figure out how to climb it, go through it or work around it.
Michael Jordan, basketball playerA champion is one who gets up when he can't.
Jack Dempsey, boxerMy motto was always to keep swinging. Whether I was in a slump or feeling badly or having trouble off the field, the only thing to do was keep swinging.
Henry Aaron, baseball playerIt's OK to lose, to die, but don't die without trying, without giving it your best.
Walter Payton, football playerAs long as a person doesn't admit he's defeated, he is not defeated — he's just a little behind, and isn't through fighting.
Darrell Royal, football coachPeople of mediocre ability sometimes achieve outstanding success because they don't know when to quit. Most men succeed because they are determined to.
George Allen, football coachBig shots are just little shots who kept shooting.

Christopher Morley, novelistSuccess is a function of persistence and doggedness and the willingness to work hard for 22 minutes to make sense of something that most people would give up on after 30 seconds.
Malcolm Gladwell, authorSuccess seems largely a matter of hanging on after others have let go.
William Feather, authorNever despair! But, if you do, work on in your despair.
Henry Tyrrell, poetDevelop success from failures. Discouragement and failure are two of the surest steppingstones to success.
Dale Carnegie, motivational speaker and authorOne thing we all know, if one does not possess persistence, one does not achieve noteworthy success in any calling.

Napoleon Hill, authorYOU MIGHT BE INTERESTED IN:Wisdom To Live By: Weekly Inspirational QuotesSurprise! The U.S. exit from the Iran nuclear deal could pose a "material risk" to profits at airlines, while Boeing (BA) and Airbus (EADSY) could see more demand for newer, more fuel-efficient jets, according to an analyst.XMajor U.S. carriers like Delta Air Lines (DAL), American Airlines (AAL) and United Airlines (UAL) already face rising fuel costs, as prices rebound from the oil crash in 2014. Delta's fuel costs jumped 20% in the first quarter. For American, they rose 26% over that time.In a research note on Tuesday, Canaccord Genuity's Ken Herbert said that if crude prices rise too fast airlines could spend less on "older aircraft (negative for the aftermarket) and be positive for the demand for new, fuel efficient aircraft, unless the overall impact on airline profitability was substantial."Fuel and labor are the airlines' two biggest costs. Withdrawal from the Iran nuclear deal and the reimposing of sanctions, announced by President Trump on Tuesday, will likely constrain Iran's oil exports, tweaking global oil prices higher.On Wednesday, U.S. crude prices jumped 3.1% to $71.17 a barrel, and Brent crude surged 3% to $77.12, with both hitting the highest levels since November 2014.Delta fell 1.4% in the stock market today, as shares make their way through a consolidation. United dropped 2.8%, and American lost 3.5%, continuing to sink further below its 50-day line, a key measure of investor support. Southwest (LUV) fell 1.5%, JetBlue (JLBU) 2.8% and Spirit Airways (SAVE) 2.4%.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseThe Iran nuclear deal, struck in 2015, eased sanctions on Iran in exchange for a scaling-back of its nuclear program.Even as Boeing and Airbus stand to lose billions in business from Iran, Herbert said that the implications of Trump's decision were "mixed" for the aerospace sector. He said the return of tougher sanctions would not have a "material negative impact" on Boeing's backlog."The risk for Boeing and Airbus is if fuel prices rise too fast, or too much, that it materially impacts airline profitability, which could be a natural headwind for order activity or backlog strength," he added. "But generally rising fuel prices, within a range, are positive for the demand for new aircraft."Boeing rallied 1.8%, while Airbus dipped 0.8%.Meanwhile, American and Allegiant Air (ALGT) face stiffer scrutiny from regulators over their maintenance practices.The Department of Transportation's Office of the Inspector General on Wednesday said it was examining the Federal Aviation Administration's process for "investigating allegations of improper maintenance" at Allegiant and American. The office also said it was looking into whether the FAA "ensures that Allegiant and American Airlines implement effective corrective actions to address the root causes of maintenance problems."The inquiry follows a "60 Minutes" report that raised doubts about Allegiant's safety practices. Shares fell 2.5% Wednesday.YOU MIGHT BE INTERESTED IN:Defense Stocks Rally As Exit From Iran Nuclear Deal Adds To Mideast TensionRoyal Dutch Shell Breaks Out Into Buy Zone As Oil Prices SurgeHow United Airlines Is Being Hurt, And Helped, By Rising Oil Prices

Lockheed Martin (LMT) was awarded a key hypersonic weapons contract from the Air Force late Wednesday as Russia and China push the race to develop the disruptive technology.XThe contract is worth up to $928 million over the life of the program, which seeks to build a weapon that could be launched from fighters and bombers.Lockheed, which also makes the F-35 joint strike fighter, beat out Boeing (BA), Northrop Grumman (NOC), Raytheon (RTN), and Orbital ATK, which is being bought by Northrop, for the contract.The contract follows an award from the Pentagon in 2016 for hypersonic test vehicles, and prototypes are expected in 2020.The hypersonic strike weapons contract was expected sometime in federal fiscal Q1, which began in October and ended in December, but the Air Force pushed back the deal to fiscal Q2, before it was finally awarded Wednesday.Lockheed shares were up 0.6% at 353.35 on the stock market today. Northrop rose 0.1% to 358.05, just below a 359.53 buy point, Boeing dipped 0.1%, and Raytheon was 0.4% higher.Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseHypersonic weapons travel at five times the speed of sound, and have the potential to be the most disruptive battlefield technology since the advent of stealth.The Air Force has another hypersonic effort called the Tactical Boost Glide program, which is being developed with DARPA and could produce a prototype by 2022 or 2023.Defense contractors are investing in the development of the potentially lucrative technology.Last week, the Boeing's Horizon X unit, along with Rolls-Royce and BAE Systems, announced they invested $37.3 million in Reaction Engines, a U.K. hypersonic engine company.Boeing has been working on hypersonic technology for years, and in 2013 a test flight of its X-51 Waverider provided proof that it was feasible.Meanwhile near-peer adversaries are pushing the development of hypersonic weapons too. China is expected to field a weapon sometime in the next decade, while Russia showed off its own offerings earlier this month.President Vladimir Putin announced the test of the Kinzhal air-launched anti-ship missile from a MiG-31 fighter during a state of the nation speech earlier this year.YOU MIGHT BE INTERESTED IN: Defense And Aerospace Stocks To Watch And Industry NewsHypersonic Weapons: The Biggest Warfighting Disrupter Since Stealth Is Coming

Union Bankshares (UBSH) saw an improvement in its IBD SmartSelect Composite Rating Thursday, from 94 to 96. X The upgrade means the stock currently tops 96% of all other stocks in terms of key performance metrics and technical strength. Winning stocks often have a 95 or higher rating in the early stages of a new price run, so that's a good item to have on your checklist when looking for the best stocks to buy and watch. Union Bankshares broke out earlier, but is now trading right around the prior 39.90 entry from a cup without handle. If a stock you're tracking clears a buy point then retreats 7% or more below the original entry price, it's considered a failed base. Wait for the stock to set up and breakout from a new base and entry price. Looking For Winning Stocks? Try This Simple RoutineOne weak spot is the company's 77 EPS Rating, which tracks quarterly and annual earnings-per-share growth. Look for that to improve to 80 or better to show it's in the top 20% of all stocks. Its Accumulation/Distribution Rating of A- shows heavy buying by institutional investors over the last 13 weeks. Get these newsletters delivered to your inbox & more info about our products & services. Privacy Policy & Terms of UseThe company posted a 34% rise in earnings for Q1. That means it's now delivered two straight quarters of rising EPS gains. Sales growth rose 54%, up from 10% in the prior quarter. That marks one quarter of increasing revenue gains. Union Bankshares earns the No. 3 rank among its peers in the Banks-Southeast industry group. Southern First Bancshares (SFST) is the No. 1-ranked stock within the group.RELATED:Which Companies Are Now Outperforming 95% Of All Stocks?See Which Stocks Just Came On — And Off — IBD's Top Stock Lists
